He moved to Vermont in 1968 and worked as a carpenter and documentary filmmaker before being elected to the Vermont House of Representatives in 1981. Sanders is a democratic socialist and has been a member of the Democratic Party since 1988. He is known for his progressive stances on issues such as income inequality, climate change, and universal healthcare. Sanders ran for president in 2016 and 2020, winning the popular vote in the latter election but losing in the Electoral College. He has been a vocal critic of corporate America and has advocated for a more equitable distribution of wealth. Sanders has also been a strong advocate for workers' rights and has pushed for higher minimum wages and stronger labor protections. Sanders has been married to Jane O'Meara Sanders since 1988. Scott Brown.passage: Scott Brown (born September 12, 1982) is an American politician and former model who served as a United States Senator from Massachusetts from 2010 to 2013. Brown was a member of the Republican Party and was the first Republican to be elected to the Senate from Massachusetts since 1972. Brown was born in Wakefield, Massachusetts, and attended Tufts University, where he earned a degree in international relations. After college, he worked as a model and appeared in several television commercials and magazine spreads. In 2004, Brown enlisted in the Massachusetts Army National Guard and served two tours of duty in Iraq. He was honorably discharged in 2013 with the rank of Captain. In 2010, Brown won a special election to succeed Ted Kennedy in the Senate. He defeated Attorney General Martha Coakley in a closely contested race that was seen as a major upset. Brown's victory was attributed to his strong campaigning and Coakley's poor performance in the final weeks of the race. During his time in the Senate, Brown was known for his moderate views and willingness to work across the aisle. He was a strong supporter of the military and veterans, and worked to expand access to healthcare for veterans. He also supported measures to combat climate change and was a vocal advocate for renewable energy. In 2012, Brown ran for re-election but was defeated by Democratic challenger Elizabeth Warren. After leaving the Senate, Brown returned to modeling and has also worked as a commentator on political issues.

CFPB.passage: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) is a United States government agency responsible for consumer protection in the financial sector. The CFPB's jurisdiction includes banks, credit unions, securities firms, payday lenders, mortgage-servicing operations, foreclosure relief services, debt collectors, and other financial companies operating in the United States. The CFPB was created as part of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010 in response to the financial crisis of 2007-2008. The CFPB is headed by a single director who is appointed by the President of the United States and confirmed by the Senate. The CFPB has the authority to supervise and enforce laws against financial institutions, as well as the power to make rules and issue regulations that govern the financial industry. The CFPB also has the authority to take enforcement action against companies that violate consumer financial laws, including the power to impose penalties and fines. The CFPB has been involved in several high-profile cases, including lawsuits against Wells Fargo for creating fake accounts and against Navient for allegedly cheating student loan borrowers.
